DateText: 9th century AH/AD 15th century-10th century AH/AD 16th century (?)
Title: Binding from One Hundred Sayings
Description: This non-original binding from Walters manuscript W.615 may date to the 9th or 10th century AH/AD 15th or 16th. The binding is dark brown goatskin (with a flap) and has a central lobed oval and pendants brushed with gold. The red leather doublures are decorated with filigree and a central lobed oval. The binding has a half-oval for the flap.
Keywords: Arabic; Islamic; Persian; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Illumination; Manuscript; Iran; Devotion; Literature -- Poetry; Literature -- Prose; Philosophy
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Iranian
